definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
1992 Consensus, statement issued after 1992 talks between PRC and Taiwan representatives, asserting that there is only one China
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
PRC state council office for Taiwan affairs, abbr. for 國務院台灣事務辦公室|国务院台湾事务办公室[Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Tai2 wan1 Shi4 wu4 Ban4 gong1 shi4]
Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会
to unify by using military force (usu. in relation to Taiwan)
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
one country, two systems (PRC proposal regarding Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan)
Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China from 2016
